article.title: DeepTest: Automated Testing of Deep-Neural-Network-driven Autonomous Cars

multiple_choice_question.text: What does a high Jaccard distance between neuron sets activated by different image transformations suggest?
choices: The transformations activate very similar sets of neurons.
The transformations have no impact on neuron activation.
The transformations activate significantly different sets of neurons.
The transformations are not effective in increasing neuron coverage.

multiple_choice_question.text: What trend does Figure 4.2 demonstrate regarding the cumulative effect of image transformations on neuron coverage?
choices: Cumulative transformations have no impact on neuron coverage.
Neuron coverage fluctuates unpredictably with cumulative transformations.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the key takeaway from Figure 6 regarding the deviations of transformed images (Ierr) compared to original images (Iorg) from human labels?
choices: Ierr and Iorg show similar deviations from human labels.
Ierr consistently shows lower deviations from human labels than Iorg.
Ierr consistently shows higher deviations from human labels than Iorg.
There is no correlation between the deviations of Ierr and Iorg from human labels.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Table 6 indicate about the effectiveness of guided transformations compared to cumulative transformations in achieving neuron coverage?
choices: Guided transformations always achieve lower neuron coverage than cumulative transformations.
Guided transformations achieve similar neuron coverage compared to cumulative transformations.
Guided transformations can achieve higher neuron coverage than cumulative transformations, especially when the baseline coverage is low.
There is no noticeable difference between the neuron coverage achieved by guided and cumulative transformations.
